snippet.title: Research ethics in the facebook era: privacy, anonymity, and oversight
snippet.description:
* Research ethics in the facebook era: privacy, anonymity, and oversight (Citations: 2)
Nathan Bos, Karrie Karahalios, Marcela Musgrove-chávez, Erika Shehan Poole, John Charles Thomas, Sarita Yardi
Ethical standards for human subjects research have not kept up with new research paradigms. Several research areas are particularly problematic for the CHI community. Online social research is testing the boundaries of public observation, third-party disclosure, and anonymization methods. Furthermore, there are differences in norms about what is and is not ethical among various research disciplines studying the Web. ...
Conference: Computer Human Interaction - CHI , pp. 2767-2770, 2009
